feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued April 02 at 5:07AM AKDT until April 03 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Winds gusting to 50 mph will cause whiteout conditions in blowing snow. Significant drifting snow is likely. Cold wind chills to 50 below zero are occurring.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 3:13AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty Winds Likely Sunday and Monday... A series of weak disturbances will create some wind impacts Sunday afternoon and evening and then stronger winds are possible for Monday afternoon and evening. For Sunday, westerly gusts of 30 to 40 mph are expected with gusts up to 50 mph for wind prone locations. For Monday, there is potential for westerly gusts of 35
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI NIIHAU OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .A northwest swell will continue to produce elevated surf along most north and west facing shores of the smaller Hawaiian Islands through this afternoon. entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 02 at 5:09AM CDT until April 02 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wet Snow Accumulations Through Mid-Morning... Snow continues to fall. A band of 2 to 5 inches is expected before exiting by mid-morning. Snowfall rates could reach up to 1 inch per hour early this morning leading to slushy or snow- covered roads. Improving conditions are expected later this morning as snow diminishes and temperatures begin to warm.

entry.summary: ...Wet Snow Accumulations Through Mid-Morning... Snow continues to fall. A band of 2 to 5 inches is expected before exiting by mid-morning. Improving conditions are expected later this morning as snow diminishes and temperatures begin to warm.
